content:
Ziet u nog wel de gewenste accounts? Anders is er mogelijk per ongeluk een nieuw profiel aangemaakt.

Als dit niet het geval is, dan moet u per account het wachtwoord nog eens ingeven en daarbij aangeven dat u het wachtwoord wilt onthouden. Zie Wachtwoordenbeheerder - Wachtwoorden onthouden, verwijderen en wijzigen in Thunderbird.

content:
Try this: 

button.email-action-flagged {   &.flagged {     fill: red !important;     stroke: blue !important;   }}


Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Show in Finder (Win: Open Folder), close TB, create a new folder named chrome, create a new document in chrome with a text editor, name it userChrome.css, Save as type: All files *.*, copy in the above code, change the colours as desired. Double-click toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets to true in Settings/General/Config. editor, restart TB.

content:
Inoltre, Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content: Thunderbird only has the last one provided, which may no longer work. Thunderbird looks to you to provide it. If the password stored at settings>privacy&security is not correct, then you need to contact your email provider.
creator: davidsk

content: I am not sure I fully understand. On setting up an account, click the new account>email menu option and, on next scree, enter just your name and email address - do NOT enter password. If the email address is with a know email provider, Thunderbird will enter that information for you. But Thunderbird cannot assist with the password. You need to get that from your email provider. If I have misunderstood, please clarify. Thank you
creator: davidsk

content:
Just a couple of things to try, I don't know how effective they will be. Assuming you are using Windows 11...

  • Go to Settings | Bluetooth & Devices | Printers & Scanners | Printer Preferences . Turn OFF the option "Let Windows manage my default printer." This setting lets applications change your default printer. I would never want that to happen - I want to choose it and I want it to stick.
  • Scroll up and select your new printer and make sure it's designated as Default.

Does that help?
creator: rednoise

content: Not sure where you're looking. if you are in compose window, press F9. that shows addressbook on left. One of the entries near top is a dropdown for addressbooks. If you set it to 'all address books', the listing will show the addressbook for each entry
creator: davidsk

content:
- account settings - click the name of one of the accounts - now, click the 'edit SMTP server' button in lower right - if the email account is correct, then, just for documentation, enter the email address in the Description field and press OK - now, repeat for the other account and click the 'edit SMTP server' button. if it shows the other account, DO NOT change it, but revert back to prior screen and click the dropdown for SMTP server and select the other SMTP server and edit it similarly the the other one.

what you have are two SMTP servers, but in editing, you are continually editing the same one. by changing the Description field , you make it easier to see from the account pane.
creator: davidsk

content:
Still having the issue. In Example1@gmail.com, I went to Account Settings. ‘Outgoing Server’ is specified as Example1@gmail.com - smtp.gmail.com. ‘Edit outgoing server’ shows

Description: Example1@gmail.com Server Name: smtp.gmail.com Port: 465 (Default: 465) Connection security: SSL/TLS Authentication method: OAuth2 User Name: Example1@gmail.com

In Example2@gmail.com, these same settings are in place. In the ‘Outgoing Server’ dropdown, the only gmail setting is for Example1@gmail.com - smtp.gmail.com

If I edit it as Example1, then Example1 has the Example 2 settings. Please clarify.
creator: apogeemail2

content: I tried editing the Description field as suggested, but it still reverted back.
creator: apogeemail2

content:
First, for example2, when you see that the SMTP server is set for example1, my instructions were NOT to edit it. instead, go back to prior screen. to the left of the 'edit smtp server' button is a dropdown menu pointing to SMTP server. click that and select the OTHER SMTP server. It's description field would not show email address. change that one and set is as the one for that account.

Another way, if you're having trouble with those menus, is to select 'account settings' menu, scroll down left side to 'Outgoing Servers SMTP' and press enter. That will bring up a list of all SMTP servers. One will have the description of example1 account. Edit the other one to be the right one for example2, including placing email address in description field. Save and exit.

Now, click account settings and then click account for example2. In lower right, if the link to SMTP server is showing the email address for example1, click the dropdown and select the other one.

If you continue to have problems, please post screenshot of the account pane showing the bottom row that links to SMTP server, and a screenshot of the 'Outgoing server SMTP' pane. thanks
creator: davidsk

content:
Yes, as you noted, I did not edit the settings as you described- and still had the problem.

Your second suggestion did work, however- the accounts are operating properly. Thank you!
creator: apogeemail2

content: If it is reordered when done, but reverts when restarted, that is an indication that thunderbird is being prevented from updating settings at shut down. That is usually caused by a VPN or an anti-virus attempting interference. If you use an antivirus other than the default Windows antivirus, or a VPN, please adjust settings to bypass email checking. you can sometimes verify this by seeing if there is more than one prefs.js in the profile (such a prefs-1.js, prefs-2.js). click help>troubleshootinginformation, scroll to 'profile folder', click 'open folder'. You will now be in the profile. Is there just one prefs.js there?
creator: davidsk
